question: Julie hits their tee shot and thinks it might be lost, so they hit another ball just to be safe, saying, "I'm going to play another one just in case.", but luckily they find their first ball*

choices.text: They can choose which ball to play without any extra shots.
Because they didn't use the word "Provisional" when they hit their 2nd shot they are not allowed to play the first ball that they have found.
Their next shot counts as their 3rd shot
Their next shot counts as their 2nd shot

explanation: In golf, if you're unsure about your first ball and decide to hit another, you must say it's a "provisional" ball. If you don't and play a second ball, that one counts even if you find the first. Without calling it provisional, your next shot with the second ball is your third shot.
